message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

This paper is about comparing different approaches to statistical machine translation, which is a topic that falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of neural networks, which is a popular technique in artificial intelligence (AI), so cs.AI is also a likely sub-category. The comparison of different approaches involves evaluating their performance, which is a task that falls under the category of machine learning (ML), specifically in the area of supervised learning. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of multidimensional quality metrics (MQM), which is a topic related to information retrieval (IR), so cs.IR is a possible sub-category as well. Finally, the use of neural networks involves optimization techniques and training algorithms, which are topics that fall under the category of neural networks (NE), so cs.NE is also a possible sub-category.
